customer_name: Pecks Farm Market II East LLC
site_name: Pecks Farm Market II East LLC

citations.narrative:
The hose to a receptacle that a billy goat drinks from is broke, leaving an area of pooling water for the goat to drink from.
The small area on the ground with minimal flow can't be considered potable water for the billy goat. Ensure to maintain a
source of potable drinking water for the billy goat.
***Correct by 2/3/2025.
The cattle pen's water-receptacle was dry at the time of inspection and when water was restored the cows were
moderately thirsty. A valve that normally maintains continuous flow to the receptacle was closed at the time. Other
animals that share the same water receptacles (fallow deer, sheep, goats) didn't appear to be thirsty when water flow was
restored. Ensure to maintain adequate potable water for the animals in sufficient quantity that provides for their health and
comfort. ***Item was corrected during inspection.
***Maintain correct from 1/31/2025 forward.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
Birds at the facility are socially housed and live in an enriched environment, however the written Program of
Environmental Enhancement for birds wasn't available for review during inspection. The facility representative said it
might be with the Attending Veterinarian (AV) for review. A written program of environmental enrichment/enhancement
that is approved by the Attending Veterinarian is required to be available and helps demonstrate that the facility plans and
provides appropriate housing environments and enrichment for their birds. Ensure to work with the attending veterinarian
to locate or obtain the Written Program of Environmental Enhancement.

The peafowl and ducks water was no longer flowing into their receptacle to keep the water clean, so their drinking water
was limited to the water on the ground that is continually refreshed with well water. The lack of a receptacle doesn't
ensure the ducks and peafowl have access to potable water. Ensure to provide and maintain sufficient access to potable
water for the peafowl and ducks.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

3.130 
   
Watering. 
The hose to a receptacle that a billy goat drinks from is broke, leaving an area of pooling water for the goat to drink from. 
The small area on the ground with minimal flow can't be considered potable water for the billy goat. Ensure to maintain a

The cattle pen's water-receptacle was dry at the time of inspection and when water was restored the cows were

animals that share the same water receptacles (fallow deer, sheep, goats) didn't appear to be thirsty when water flow was 
restored. Ensure to maintain adequate potable water for the animals in sufficient quantity that provides for their health and 
comfort. ***Item was corrected during inspection.

3.154  Repeat
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
Birds at the facility are socially housed and live in an enriched environment, however the written Program of

might be with the Attending Veterinarian (AV) for review. A written program of environmental enrichment/enhancement

provides appropriate housing environments and enrichment for their birds. Ensure to work with the attending veterinarian 
to locate or obtain the Written Program of Environmental Enhancement. 
3.156  Repeat
   
Watering 
The peafowl and ducks water was no longer flowing into their receptacle to keep the water clean, so their drinking water 
was limited to the water on the ground that is continually refreshed with well water. The lack of a receptacle doesn't 
ensure the ducks and peafowl have access to potable water. Ensure to provide and maintain sufficient access to potable

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
